Element.cpp
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 /* File: Element.cpp
2  * Author: David Lordan, UMass Lowell Computer Science
3  * david_lordan@student.uml.edu
4  *
5  * Created on October 11th, 2014, 4:46 PM, modified on Oct 23rd at 4:45 PM to
6  * add additional documentation.
7  *
8  * This is the implementation file for the Element class, which is
9  * used when reading an XML file. Each object of the class can store
10  * a tag's name, what line it was found on, the element content, the element's
11  * attributes, its level within an element tree, children and a reference to it's parent.
12  * Much of the design for this class was taken from the lecture notes of Prof.
13  * Jesse Heines of UMass Lowell for the Fall 2014 91.204-Computing IV class.
14  */
15

22 Element::Element() {
23  strTagName = "";
24  lineNumber = 0;
25  strContent = "";
26 }
27 
34 Element::Element(const Element& orig) {
35  strTagName = orig.getTagName();
36  lineNumber = orig.getLineNo();
37  strContent = orig.getStrContent();
38 }
39 
53 Element::Element(string tagName, int nLineNo, string content, string currentLine) {
54 
55  strContent = content;
56 
57  strTagName = tagName;
58 
59  lineNumber = nLineNo;
60 
61  level = 0;
62 
63  findAttributes(currentLine);
64 }

122 void Element::displayAttributes() {
123 
124  if (!vecAttribute.empty()) {
125 
126  for (int i = 0; i < vecAttribute.size(); i++) {
127  if (this->getLevel() != 0) {
128  for (int j = 1; j < this->getLevel(); j++) {
129  cout << ".";
130  }
131  } else {
132  cout << "*** ";
133  }
134 
135  cout << "Attribute name: " << vecAttribute[i]->getAttName();
136  cout << ", Attribute value: " << vecAttribute[i]->getAttValue() << endl;
137  }
138  }
139 }
140 
149 void Element::findAttributes(string currentLine) {
150  string name;
151  string value;
152 
153  int searchStart = 0;
154  int i = 0;
155 
156  while (currentLine.find("=\"", searchStart) != string::npos) {
157 
158  name = currentLine.substr(currentLine.find(' ', searchStart) + 1,
159  currentLine.find('=', searchStart) -
160  currentLine.find(' ', searchStart) - 1);
161 
162  int valStart = currentLine.find("=\"", searchStart) + 2;
163  int valEnd = currentLine.find('"', valStart);
164 
165  value = currentLine.substr(valStart, valEnd - valStart);
166 
167  Attribute* AttributePtr = new Attribute(name, value);
168 
169  vecAttribute.push_back(AttributePtr);
170 
171  searchStart = currentLine.find("\" ", searchStart + 1);
172 
173  i++;
174  }
175 
176  while (currentLine.find("=\'", searchStart) != string::npos) {
177 
178  name = currentLine.substr(currentLine.find(' ', searchStart) + 1,
179  currentLine.find('=', searchStart) -
180  currentLine.find(' ', searchStart) - 1);
181 
182  int valStart = currentLine.find("=\'", searchStart) + 2;
183  int valEnd = currentLine.find('\'', valStart);
184 
185  value = currentLine.substr(valStart, valEnd - valStart);
186 
187  Attribute* AttributePtr = new Attribute(name, value);
188 
189  vecAttribute.push_back(AttributePtr);
190 
191  searchStart = currentLine.find("\' ", searchStart + 1);
192 
193  i++;
194  }
195 }

204 void Element::addChild(Element* newChild) {
205  noOfChildren++;
206  vecChildren.push_back(newChild);
207 }

263 bool Element::hasAttributes() {
264  if (vecAttribute.empty())
265  return false;
266  else
267  return true;
268 }
